item.title: Britain's longest-known COVID-19 patient dies after 15 months...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
A British man has died 15 months after first contracting COVID-19, his wife said. Jason Kelk, 49, was hospitalized in Leeds in March 2020, according to The Guardian. However, he died Friday after he was transferred to a hospice center. Kelk is believed to have been Britain’s longest-known COVID-19 patient. “It was definitely important for him to do it on his terms. But he is leaving an awful ...

item.title: Crowds gather at Stonehenge for Solstice despite advice...
item.description:
apnews.com
LONDON (AP) — Dozens of people have ignored advice not to travel to Stonehenge for the annual summer solstice celebrations, which were cancelled Monday due to coronavirus concerns. English Heritage, which looks after the Neolithic monument, had planned a live feed of the sunrise at Stonehenge for the second year in a row.

item.title: MYSTERY: Iran's nuclear power plant undergoes emergency shutdown...
item.description:
apnews.com
TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iran’s sole nuclear power plant has undergone an unexplained temporary emergency shutdown, state TV reported on Sunday. An official from state electric company Tavanir, Gholamali Rakhshanimehr, said on a talk show that the Bushehr plant shutdown began on Saturday and would last "for three to four days.”

item.title: Officials: Deadly Pride parade crash appears unintentional...
item.description:
apnews.com
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. (AP) — A member of a men’s chorus group unintentionally slammed into fellow chorists at the start of a Pride parade in South Florida, killing one member of the group and seriously injuring another, the group's director said Sunday, correcting initial speculation that it was a hate crime directed at the gay community.

item.title: 8 children killed after crash in drenched Alabama...
item.description:
apnews.com
ATLANTA (AP) — Eight children in a van from a youth home for abused or neglected children were killed in a fiery multi-vehicle crash on a wet interstate that also killed a man and his baby in another vehicle, the most devastating blow from a tropical depression that claimed 12 lives in Alabama as it caused flash floods and spurred tornadoes that destroyed dozens of homes.
